title: Fear & Greed Index - NASDAQ & Crypto Market Sentiment
footer_copyright: © 2026 Fear & Greed Index. All rights reserved.
intro_desc: Track NASDAQ and Crypto market sentiment in real-time. The Fear & Greed Index quantifies market participants' emotions on a scale of 0 to 100.
data_unavailable_desc: Please visit CNN directly to check.
what_title: What is the Fear & Greed Index?
what_desc: The Fear & Greed Index measures market sentiment on a scale from 0 to 100. A score close to 0 indicates extreme fear, while a score close to 100 indicates extreme greed among market participants.
what_crypto_desc: Provided by Alternative.me, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index measures sentiment in the Bitcoin and cryptocurrency market. It analyzes 6 factors: volatility, market volume, social media, surveys, Bitcoin dominance, and Google Trends.
what_stock_desc: Provided by CNN, this index measures investment sentiment in the US stock market (S&P 500, NASDAQ, etc.). It analyzes 7 factors: stock price momentum, stock price strength, put/call ratio, junk bond demand, market volatility (VIX), safe haven demand, and stock price breadth.
howto_1_desc: Market participants are extremely fearful. Contrarian investors may see this as a buying opportunity.
howto_2_desc: Anxiety is spreading in the market. A cautious approach is needed, but it could be a good entry point.
howto_3_desc: Market sentiment is balanced. This is a wait-and-see zone with no clear direction.
howto_4_desc: Market participants are optimistic. Watch for overheating signals and manage risk accordingly.
howto_5_desc: The market is overheated. Contrarian investors may consider this a selling opportunity.
faq_1_a: Yes, it's completely free! No sign-up required — just visit and check the indices instantly.
faq_2_q: Q. How often is the data updated?
faq_2_a: The Crypto Fear & Greed Index updates daily, while the CNN Fear & Greed Index changes in real-time during US market hours. This service auto-refreshes every 5 minutes.
faq_3_q: Q. Should I make investment decisions based on this index alone?
faq_3_a: No. The Fear & Greed Index is a supplementary indicator for gauging market sentiment. Investment decisions should consider multiple factors including financial statements, technical analysis, and macroeconomic indicators.
faq_4_q: Q. Does it work on mobile?
faq_4_a: Yes! The site is fully optimized for mobile devices. Use it comfortably on any device with a web browser.
disclaimer_desc: Information provided by this service is for reference only and does not constitute investment advice or solicitation. All investment decisions and responsibilities lie with the individual investor.
contact_description: Thank you for your interest. Please fill out the form below for partnership inquiries.
about_what_desc: Fear & Greed Index is a free web service that shows real-time investment sentiment for NASDAQ (CNN) and Crypto (Alternative.me) markets. Check market sentiment at a glance without any sign-up.
about_why_desc: "Should I buy or sell now?" — Every investor faces this daily dilemma. By presenting market fear and greed as objective numbers, we help investors make rational decisions free from emotional bias.
about_mission_desc: We aim for 'data-driven investment decisions, not emotional ones.' By visualizing market sentiment intuitively, we want to help investors make calmer, more rational decisions.
about_feature_1: Real-time Fear & Greed Index — Crypto & NASDAQ sentiment at a glance
about_feature_2: 7-day trend chart — Visualize recent sentiment changes
about_feature_3: Auto-refresh — Latest data updated every 5 minutes
about_value_1_desc: Instead of complex charts, our intuitive semicircular gauges let you grasp market sentiment instantly.
about_value_2_desc: Compare crypto and stock market Fear & Greed indices side by side to identify cross-market sentiment differences.
about_value_3_desc: No sign-up, no app installation. Anyone with a web browser can use it completely free of charge.
guide_intro: Learn investment strategies using the Fear & Greed Index and how to analyze market sentiment. Here are 5 essential guides for smarter investing.
guide_1_desc: Warren Buffett famously said, "Be fearful when others are greedy and greedy when others are fearful." Consider buying opportunities when the index shows Extreme Fear (0-24) and selling opportunities during Extreme Greed (75-100).
guide_1_detail: Pro tip: Consider dollar-cost averaging when the index drops below 20, and taking partial profits when it rises above 80.
guide_2_desc: Crypto and traditional stock market Fear & Greed indices often move in different directions. Large divergences may signal capital rotation between markets, serving as a portfolio rebalancing signal.
guide_2_detail: Watch for: If crypto shows extreme greed while stocks show fear, risk appetite may be concentrating in crypto.
guide_3_desc: Using the Fear & Greed Index for dollar-cost averaging effectively reduces emotional investing. Increase buying when the index is low and decrease when high to lower your average cost basis.
guide_3_levels: Extreme Fear (0-24): Aggressive buying | Fear (25-44): Increase allocation | Neutral (45-55): Maintain regular buying | Greed (56-74): Reduce allocation | Extreme Greed (75-100): Pause buying or take profits
guide_4_desc: The VIX (Volatility Index), a key component of CNN's Fear & Greed Index, measures market uncertainty. VIX above 30 indicates high fear, while below 15 suggests stability. Combining the Fear & Greed Index with VIX enables more accurate market analysis.
guide_4_detail: VIX 20-30: Caution zone | VIX above 30: Fear zone | VIX below 15: Stability zone
guide_5_desc: While the Fear & Greed Index is a useful supplementary indicator, investment decisions should never rely on it alone. Consider fundamental analysis, technical analysis, and macroeconomic indicators comprehensively. Past patterns are not guaranteed to repeat.
guide_5_detail: Always remember: The final decision and responsibility for investments lies with you.
guide_disclaimer: This guide is for educational purposes only and does not recommend any specific investment product or strategy.
privacy_intro: 'Fear & Greed Index' (hereinafter 'the Service') values users' privacy and complies with relevant laws.
privacy_collect_desc: The Service does not require registration and does not directly collect personal information. Through the contact form, we may collect your name, email, and message, processed via Formspree.
privacy_cookies_desc: The Service uses browser localStorage to save theme and language preferences. This information is stored only on your device and is not transmitted to any server.
privacy_api_desc: The Service uses the Alternative.me API and CNN data to display Fear & Greed Index values. Your IP address may be transmitted to these services during data retrieval.
privacy_ads_desc: The Service displays ads through Google AdSense. Google may use cookies to serve personalized ads.
privacy_third_desc: The Service uses the following third-party services:
privacy_third_alternative: Alternative.me — Crypto Fear & Greed Index data provider
privacy_third_cnn: CNN — Stock market Fear & Greed Index data provider
privacy_changes_desc: This Privacy Policy may be updated as needed, and changes will be announced on this page.
privacy_contact_desc: For privacy-related inquiries, please use the contact form on the homepage.
